There are $n$ ants on a circle of length $m$. Each ant moves one unit of distance per unit of time. Initially, the $i$-th ant is at position $s_i$ and facing direction $d_i$ (either L for left or R for right).  Positions are numbered counterclockwise.

All ants move simultaneously. When two ants meet, they both change their direction.

Given the number of ants ($n$), the circle's length ($m$), the time ($t$), the initial positions ($s_i$), and directions ($d_i$) of each ant, determine the position of each ant after $t$ time units.

You have multiple ants moving on a circular track. Each ant starts at a specific position and direction (clockwise or counterclockwise).  They move simultaneously, and when two ants meet, they change directions.  Given the initial positions, directions, and the time they move, find the final positions of all the ants.
